attributes.description: The type of filter, one of ``Butterworth``, ``FIR``, ``IIR``, ``Bessel``, ``Cosine SAC Taper``. Please give some more information with one or more of the other attributes. ``Cosine SAC Taper`` describes the frequency domain taper the SAC software package employs during instrument deconvolution.
attributes.name: filter_type

attributes.description: The lower corner frequency of the filter if applicable in Hz.
attributes.name: lower_corner_frequency

attributes.description: The upper corner frequency of the filter if applicable in Hz.
attributes.name: upper_corner_frequency

attributes.description: The order of the filter if applicable.
attributes.name: filter_order

attributes.description: The number of filter passes if applicable.
attributes.name: number_of_passes

attributes.description: The frequency limits of the SAC frequency domain cosine taper in Hz from lowest to highest.
attributes.name: sac_cosine_taper_frequency_limits

bandpass_filter.description: A Bandpass filter. There is a huge variety of bandpass filters out there and this activity cannot capture them all in full detail.
bandpass_filter.label: Bandpass Filter
bandpass_filter.name: bandpass_filter

attributes.description: The type of filter, e.g. `Butterworth`, `FIR`, `Chebyshev Type I/II`, `Bessel`, ...
attributes.name: filter_type

attributes.description: The lower corner frequency of the filter if applicable in Hz
attributes.name: lower_corner_frequency

attributes.description: The upper corner frequency of the filter if applicable in Hz
attributes.name: uppoer_corner_frequency

attributes.description: The order of the filter if applicable.
attributes.name: filter_order

attributes.description: The number of filter passes if applicable.
attributes.name: number_of_passes

attributes.description: The transition band width in the case of a Chebychev filter.
attributes.name: chebychev_transition_bw

attributes.description: The attenuation factor in the case of a Chebychev filter.
attributes.name: chebychev_attenuation_factor

attributes.description: A string denoting the type of adjoint source.
attributes.name: adjoint_source_type

attributes.description: A URI pointing to a detailed description of the adjoint source, for example a DOI link to a publication.
attributes.name: adjoint_source_type_uri

attributes.description: The type of performed cross correlation as a string.
attributes.name: correlation_type

attributes.description: The type of performed cross correlation as a string.
attributes.name: max_lag_time_in_sec

cross_correlate.description: Cross correlate data of two stations. This does not contain information about the used data as that is captured by the incoming entities.
cross_correlate.label: Cross Correlate
cross_correlate.name: cross_correlate

attributes.description: The time of the first sample in UTC after cutting it.
attributes.name: new_start_time

attributes.description: The time of the last sample in UTC after cutting it.
attributes.name: new_end_time

cut.description: Cut the data resulting in a shorter trace.
cut.label: Cut
cut.name: cut

attributes.description: The decimation factor
attributes.name: factor

decimate.description: Downsample the waveform data by an integer factor. Any applied anti-alias filtering has to be described by a filtering activity.
decimate.label: Decimate
decimate.name: decimate

attributes.description: The method used to remove the trend from the data. ``detrend`` means substracting the best fitting linear line, ``demean`` removes the mean, and ``simple`` subtracts a line through the first and last point.
attributes.name: detrending_method

attributes.description: The order of the derivative, e.g. the nth derivative.
attributes.name: order

attributes.description: The differentiation method.
attributes.name: differentiation_method

attributes.description: Units of the input data in a common abbreviation, e.g. `m`, `m/s`, `nm/s^2`, ...
attributes.name: input_units

attributes.description: Units of the output data in a common abbreviation, e.g. `m`, `m/s`, `nm/s^2`, ...
attributes.name: output_units

differentiate.description: Differentiate the data with respect to time.
differentiate.label: Differentiate
differentiate.name: differentiate

attributes.description: The factor by which to divide.
attributes.name: divisor

divide.description: Divide each value of the data by a certain factor. This is implied by many operations but sometimes useful to capture in its own right.
divide.label: Divide
divide.name: divide

attributes.description: The type of filter, e.g. `Butterworth`, `FIR`, `Chebyshev Type I/II`, `Bessel`, ...
attributes.name: filter_type

attributes.description: The corner frequency of the filter if applicable in Hz
attributes.name: corner_frequency

attributes.description: The order of the filter if applicable.
attributes.name: filter_order

attributes.description: The number of filter passes if applicable.
attributes.name: number_of_passes

attributes.description: The transition band width in the case of a Chebychev filter.
attributes.name: chebychev_transition_bw

attributes.description: The attenuation factor in the case of a Chebychev filter.
attributes.name: chebychev_attenuation_factor

attributes.description: The order of the integration, e.g. the nth anti-derivative.
attributes.name: order

attributes.description: The integration method.
attributes.name: integration_method

attributes.description: Units of the input data in a common abbreviation, e.g. `m`, `m/s`, `nm/s^2`, ...
attributes.name: input_units

attributes.description: Units of the output data in a common abbreviation, e.g. `m`, `m/s`, `nm/s^2`, ...
attributes.name: output_units

integrate.description: Integrate the data with respect to time.
integrate.label: Integrate
integrate.name: integrate

attributes.description: The method used to interpolate the samples. ``weighted average slopes`` is the interpolation method use by SAC and detailed in a 1976 paper by Wiggins. This is in wide use and thus offered as a special option here.
attributes.name: interpolation_method
attributes.pattern: weighted average slopes|linear spline|quadratic spline|cubic spline|linear|nearest

attributes.description: The time of the first sample in UTC after the interpolation.
attributes.name: new_start_time

attributes.description: The number of samples after the interpolation.
attributes.name: new_number_of_samples

attributes.description: The sampling rate after the interpolation.
attributes.name: new_sampling_rate

interpolate.description: Interpolate the data to new sampling points.
interpolate.label: Interpolate
interpolate.name: interpolate

attributes.description: The type of filter, e.g. `Butterworth`, `FIR`, `Chebyshev Type I/II`, `Bessel`, ...
attributes.name: filter_type

attributes.description: The corner frequency of the filter if applicable in Hz
attributes.name: corner_frequency

attributes.description: The order of the filter if applicable.
attributes.name: filter_order

attributes.description: The number of filter passes if applicable.
attributes.name: number_of_passes

attributes.description: The transition band width in the case of a Chebychev filter.
attributes.name: chebychev_transition_bw

attributes.description: The attenuation factor in the case of a Chebychev filter.
attributes.name: chebychev_attenuation_factor

attributes.description: A string describing the applied merging strategy.
attributes.name: merging_strategy

merge.description: Merge several traces into one. This is very implementation dependent and thus the activity should be associated with a software agent.
merge.label: Merge
merge.name: merge

attributes.description: The factor by which to multiply.
attributes.name: factor

multiply.description: Multiply each value of the data with a certain factor. This is implied by many operations but sometimes useful to capture in its own right.
multiply.label: Multiply
multiply.name: multiply

attributes.description: The used normalization method.
attributes.name: normalization_method

attributes.description: The value that will be used to fill missing values with.
attributes.name: fill_value

attributes.description: The time of the first sample in UTC after padding it.
attributes.name: new_start_time

attributes.description: The time of the last sample in UTC after padding it.
attributes.name: new_end_time

pad.description: Pad the data resulting in a longer trace.
pad.label: Pad
pad.name: pad

attributes.description: The applied water level in dB.
attributes.name: water_level

attributes.description: Units of the input data in a common abbreviation, e.g. `m`, `m/s`, `nm/s^2`, ...
attributes.name: input_units

attributes.description: Units of the output data in a common abbreviation, e.g. `m`, `m/s`, `nm/s^2`, ...
attributes.name: output_units

attributes.description: The window applied to the signal in the Fourier domain.
attributes.name: frequency_domain_window

attributes.description: The time of the first sample in UTC after the interpolation.
attributes.name: new_start_time

attributes.description: The number of samples after the interpolation.
attributes.name: new_number_of_samples

attributes.description: The sampling rate after the interpolation.
attributes.name: new_sampling_rate

resample.description: Resample the data in the frequency domain.
resample.label: Resample
resample.name: resample

attributes.description: The rotation method.
attributes.name: method

rotate.description: Rotate multi-component data. The precise rotation angles could be inferred by comparing the dip and azimuth of inputs and outputs. Alternatively the rotation method can be specified.
rotate.label: Rotate
rotate.name: rotate

attributes.description: Textual description of the added response. If more details are needed, then this activity should use an entity that points to the used response.
attributes.name: description

attributes.description: Units of the input data in a common abbreviation, e.g. `m`, `m/s`, `nm/s^2`, ...
attributes.name: input_units

attributes.description: Units of the output data in a common abbreviation, e.g. `m`, `m/s`, `nm/s^2`, ...
attributes.name: output_units

attributes.description: A string describing the method used to create the stack.
attributes.name: stacking_method

stack_cross_correlations.description: Stack a number of cross correlations.
stack_cross_correlations.label: Stack Cross Correlations
stack_cross_correlations.name: stack_cross_correlations

attributes.description: The type applied window.
attributes.name: window_type

attributes.description: The width of the taper at each end. Must be between 0.0 and 0.5.
attributes.name: taper_width

attributes.description: `'left'`, `'right'`, or `'both'`
attributes.name: side

taper.description: Apply a taper window to the data.
taper.label: Taper
taper.name: taper

waveform_simulation.description: Generate data by running some numerical or analytic code. Must be associated with one or more agents and use some entities to achieve a useful description.
waveform_simulation.label: Waveform Simulation
waveform_simulation.name: waveform_simulation

attributes.description: The name of the organization.
attributes.name: name

attributes.description: The website of the organization.
attributes.name: website

organization.description: An agent denoting an organization. This is useful to describe who is associated with what organization (``wasAssociatedWith``). An organization can also have any number of additional attributes in the ``SEIS-PROV`` namespace to describe it in more detail.
organization.name: organization

attributes.description: The name of the person.
attributes.name: name

attributes.description: The email address of the person.
attributes.name: email

person.description: A person is an agent either denoting who is responsible for a certain activity (``wasAssociatedWith``) or who is responsible for the actions of another agent (``actedOnBehalfOf``). This is useful to state who performed a particular task. A person in the ``SEIS-PROV`` namespace must have a name and can have an email address. A person can also have any number of additional attributes in the ``SEIS-PROV`` namespace to describe it in more detail.
person.name: person

attributes.description: The name of the software.
attributes.name: software_name

attributes.description: The version number of the used software.
attributes.name: software_version

attributes.description: The website where one can find further information.
attributes.name: website

attributes.description: The digital object identifier for the software.
attributes.name: doi

software_agent.description: This agent describes the software used for a particular task. It requires some attributes to be able to uniquely determine the used software including the version. If you use the development version of a particular software you should reflect that in the version number.
software_agent.name: software_agent

attributes.description: The latitude of the station in WGS84.
attributes.name: latitude

attributes.description: The longitude of the station in WGS84.
attributes.name: longitude

attributes.description: The elevation of the station in meter above the null level on WGS84.
attributes.name: elevation_in_m

attributes.description: The burial of the station in meter.
attributes.name: local_depth_in_m

attributes.description: The orientation of the adjoint source, either N (north), E (east), Z (up), T (transverse), or R (radial). If that is not sufficient, please use the dip and azimuth attributes.
attributes.name: orientation

attributes.description: Dip of the component in degrees, down from horizontal, same definition as in StationXML.
attributes.name: dip

attributes.description: Azimuth of the component in degrees from north, clockwise, same definition as in StationXML.
attributes.name: azimuth

attributes.description: The id of the recording station.
attributes.name: station_id

attributes.description: The number of samples in the trace.
attributes.name: number_of_samples

attributes.description: The sampling rate of the data.
attributes.name: sampling_rate

attributes.description: Units of the adjoint source as a common abbreviation, e.g. m, m/s, nm/s^2, ...
attributes.name: units

attributes.description: A string denoting the type of adjoint source.
attributes.name: adjoint_source_type

attributes.description: A URI pointing to a detailed description of the adjoint source, for example a DOI link to a publication.
attributes.name: adjoint_source_type_uri

attributes.description: The calculation of many types of adjoint sources will automatically yield a misfit value denoting the similarity of usually observed and synthetic seismograms.
attributes.name: misfit_value

adjoint_source.description: One component of an adjoint source used in adjoint simulations. The location can be specified either in geographical coordinates (WGS84) or as the SEED identifier of the corresponding station. The definition of geographic coordinates is the same as in StationXML. Any processing applied to the data before the adjoint source has been calculated (window picking, filtering, ...) has to be described by provenance records on the waveform entities.
adjoint_source.label: Adjoint Source
adjoint_source.name: adjoint_source

attributes.description: The type of performed cross correlation as a string.
attributes.name: correlation_type

attributes.description: The maximum lag time used during the calculation in seconds.
attributes.name: max_lag_time_in_sec

attributes.description: The maximum correlation coefficient
attributes.name: max_correlation_coefficient

attributes.description: The SEED identifier of station A.
attributes.name: seed_id_a

attributes.description: The SEED identifier of station B.
attributes.name: seed_id_b

cross_correlation.description: A cross correlation between two stations A and B. Station metadata is not recorded here as it is part of either SEED or StationXML files. Any previously applied processing is also not part of the entity but rather of the entity used by the activity generating this one.
cross_correlation.label: Cross Correlation
cross_correlation.name: cross_correlation

attributes.description: The type of performed cross correlations as a string. Only useful if the same for all cross correlations, otherwise that information must be stored in the provenance records of the single cross correlations.
attributes.name: correlation_type

attributes.description: The number of cross correlations used to calculate the stack.
attributes.name: correlation_count

attributes.description: The method used to create the stack.
attributes.name: stacking_method

attributes.description: The SEED identifier of station A.
attributes.name: seed_id_a

attributes.description: The SEED identifier of station B.
attributes.name: seed_id_b

attributes.description: The name of the model.
attributes.name: model_name

attributes.description: The type of model as a short, descriptive string, e.g. ``'1D'``, ``'3D'``, ``'axially symmetric'``, ...
attributes.name: model_type

attributes.description: A DOI pointing to a publication of the model.
attributes.name: doi

attributes.description: URL to a website with more information.
attributes.name: website

attributes.description: A short description of the model.
attributes.name: description

earth_model.description: An earth model. Its main use is to illustrate the origin of synthetic seismograms.
earth_model.label: Earth Model
earth_model.name: earth_model

attributes.description: The name of the file.
attributes.name: filename

attributes.description: The location of the file in a way that can be discovered. Can be a URL, a file path, or something similar.
attributes.name: location

attributes.description: The type of location. Examples include ``Filename``, ``URL``, ``HDF5 Data Set``, ``SFTP Address``, ...
attributes.name: location_type

file.description: In some cases arbitrary files are needed to describe the provenance of something. Examples are special source code files who's information cannot be represented in the ``Input Parameter`` entity. This entity allows to refer to arbitrary files. Each file is represented by a filename, a location, and a location type. The location might be a URL; then provenance discovery is simple. It might also be a filename or a path in a container format. Users are responsible to either ship the files alongside the provenance information or provide access by other means.
file.label: File
file.name: file

input_parameters.description: The input parameters for a program like a waveform solvers as a list of key, value pairs. Each key can live in the ``SEIS-PROV`` namespace.
input_parameters.label: Input Parameters
input_parameters.name: input_parameters

attributes.description: The SEED id of the recording station.
attributes.name: seed_id

attributes.description: An optional description of the waveform trace. This has no technical meaning but serves to make the provenance documents easier to understand.
attributes.name: description

attributes.description: The component of the recording. Many algorithms require a specific component and this attribute enables the description of these algorithms without using a specific SEED id.
attributes.name: component

attributes.description: The time of the first sample in UTC.
attributes.name: start_time

attributes.description: The number of samples in the waveform trace.
attributes.name: number_of_samples

attributes.description: The sampling rate of the data.
attributes.name: sampling_rate

attributes.description: Units of the waveform data in a common abbreviation, e.g. `m`, `m/s`, `nm/s^2`, ...
attributes.name: units

attributes.description: Azimuth of the component in degrees from north, clockwise, same definition as in StationXML.
attributes.name: azimuth

attributes.description: Dip of the component in degrees, down from horizontal, same definition as in StationXML.
attributes.name: dip

waveform_trace.description: Represents a continuous, equally sampled observed or synthetic waveform trace. Most attributes are optional and can be used to describe either very detailed or fairly general provenance information.
waveform_trace.label: Waveform Trace
waveform_trace.name: waveform_trace
